summary: G. Robert Blakey was involved with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). As indicated by a letter dated July 19, 1978, Blakey requested assistance from Scott Breckinridge at the CIA to arrange interviews in Mexico with individuals like June Cobb Sharp and Henry P. Lopez. This suggests Blakey was actively involved in the investigation of the JFK assassination, specifically in gathering information from potential witnesses or individuals of interest in Mexico. The documents also indicate his role in managing the committee's operations, as evidenced by the certification report detailing the payroll for the Select Committee on Assassinations.
significance: G. Robert Blakey's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as a key figure within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His correspondence with the CIA and involvement in arranging interviews in Mexico highlight his active participation in the investigation and information gathering process related to the assassination.
